=Applications by area=

==Quantum Dots==

<img src="http://pi-qmc.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/images/SAD.jpg" alt="Charge density around a Si/Ge quantum dot, from a path integral simulation." width="200" height="150" align="right"/>

<ul>
<li>
Sutharsan Ketharanathan, Sourabh Sinha, John Shumway, and Jeff Drucker,
&ldquo;<em>Electron charging in 
epitaxial Ge quantum dots on Si(001),</em>&rdquo;
<a href="http://link.aip.org/link/?JAPIAU/105/044312/1">
J. Appl Phys. <b>105</b>, 044312 (2009)</a>
</li>
<li>Lei Zhang, Jesper Pedersen, Matthew J. Gilbert, and J. Shumway,
<em>&ldquo;Path integral study of the role of correlation in exchange coupling
of spins in double quantum dots and optical lattices,&rdquo;</em>
(<a href="http://arxiv.org/abs/0809.0038">arXiv:0809.0038</a>). Note: <a
href="http://www.nanohub.org/tools/spincoupleddots">the nanoHUB tool

yourself.</li>
<li>
M. Harowitz, Daejin Shin, and J. Shumway, <em>&quot;Path-Integral 
Quantum Monte Carlo Techniques for Self-Assembled Quantum
Dots,&quot;</em> 
<a
href="http://www.springerlink.com/content/k3233844185l2k55">J. of Low Temp.
Phys. <strong>140</strong>, 211-226
(2005)</a>.
</li>
</ul>
